DataElement.preferredName: Biopsy Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to assessments of the removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biopsy Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have tumor lesio
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have tumor lesion readily accessible for biopsy per the investigator's discretion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is disease suitable for assessment by pre- and post-biopsies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had core biopsy within 7 days prior to day 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have tumor lesion safely accessible for biopsy per the investigator's discretion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have tumors deemed easily accessible for biopsies with low likelihood of complication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have tumors determined to be easily accessible for biopsy (e.g. pleural-based lesions, peripheral lymph nodes, soft tissue metastases, large liver metastases, etc.)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have biopsy in permissible site including extremities: upper (including shoulder) and lower (including hip) and/or Trunk: Body wall?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have at least one lesion that is safely accessible for biopsy unless medically contraindicated?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a tumor that is readily accessible for biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a site of disease deemed accessible for biopsy at no or minimal risk to the patient (including through the use of image-guidance)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in the dose Expansion cohort is tissue accessible for fine needle and/or core needle biopsy for molecular testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have the presence of a lesion (bone or soft tissue) amenable to image-guided percutaneous biopsy adequate for next generation sequencing (NGS), and planned to undergo core biopsy after trial registration but prior to cycle 1 day 1 of therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a tumor site amenable to biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a biopsiable disease and at least one separate measurable lesion?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient consents to biopsies, does patient have a tumor site amenable to biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient is undergoing diagnostic workup and is likely to begin an Appendix A therapy, can fresh tissue be obtained prior to starting the Appendix A therapy as part of a standard of care procedure?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have distant metastasis and/or local recurrence accessible for biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient does not have biopsy-confirmed metastatic disease, does patient have clinical and/or radiologic suspicion of metastatic TNBC to undergo a standard of care biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have distant metastasis and/or local recurrence accessible for biopsy and is willing to undergo two mandatory biopsies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in the dose expansion phase (PD cohort): Does patient have at least one lesion suitable for biopsy without significant risk to the patient?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in the expansion cohort, does patient have lesions that are amenable to research biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have tumors that are safely accessible for biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the dose escalation cohort, does patient have evaluable disease that is amenable to biopsy?

DataElement.changeDescription: 4-15-19 corrected typo in definition. 12/8/16 tt, approved/released. 11/30/16 tt, 9984.
